turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> hello <UNIN/> can you hear me ok?

turns.text: Yeah I can hear you, hi.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure, um, I'm Amanda Jackson and I'm nineteen years old.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Nineteen years old OK Amanda, and how can I help you this <UNIN/> afternoon?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so it's being going on for a few days now. Um, it's not happened before and I'm bit worried. I've <UNSURE>uh it</UNSURE> quite hurts when I kind of pee.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and yeah it's like I'm going to the toilet a lot more, um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And it's really, like I can't, like go to uni properly. I'm just like constantly looking for the toilet.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> it kind of hurts sometimes when I'm, like in at the bottom of my tummy as well.

turns.text: Right OK. I'm sorry to hear there's a lot going on there and I can, see why it's affecting you. Um, so you mentioned it's been going on for last three days, mainly the burning pain when you pass urine. Um, you said <UNSURE>you're</UNSURE> going to the toilet more often as well, that right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah <UNSURE>it's</UNSURE> been going on for a little bit longer than three days I think actually, maybe just under a week. Um.

turns.text: <UNSURE>Ohh and a</UNSURE> week, sorry <UNSURE>my</UNSURE> <UNIN/>. OK, uh.

turns.text: Sorry no I <UNIN/> didn't explain it properly before, um yeah <UNSURE>no I</UNSURE> it's been going on for about just under a week.

turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.text: Um, and yeah I <UNIN/> notice a sort of burning, stinging, when I when I go to the toilet, yeah.

turns.text: <UNIN/> <UNSURE>Are you noticing</UNSURE> any, anything in your urine, predominantly blood or um, discolouration of urine?

turns.text: Yeah, I think just today <UNIN/>.

turns.text: <UNIN/> OK. Um, fine we'll we'll have to definitely explore that <UNSURE> in a little bit or </UNSURE> detail later on. Um, you also mentioned some tummy pain as well, can you tell me <UNSURE> a </UNSURE> bit more about that pain?

turns.text: Um, I wouldn't describe it as crampy I don't think it's like a period pain, it's a bit different, it's, <UNSURE>it's</UNSURE> hard to say, an achey pain I suppose.

turns.text: <UNSURE>OK.</UNSURE>

turns.text: <UNSURE>An aching</UNSURE> pain, OK. And does the pain move anywhere else? Does it move towards your back? Towards your sides?

turns.text: <UNIN/> OK, all right. Um, any other symptoms? <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Nausea? Vomiting?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and sometimes it's quite, it's quite variable like sometimes it's a bit softer, sometimes it's a bit, <UNIN/> sorry if it's a bit disgusting but like, sometimes it's a bit <UNSURE>uh harder</UNSURE> and kind of hard to predict.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right but, <UNSURE>and you've noticed</UNSURE> no <UNSURE>new symptoms?</UNSURE> No, no, no new symptoms in your bowels?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Like, <UNSURE>yeah OK.</UNSURE>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh. OK, all right. Um, and Amanda sometimes we have to ask quite sensitive questions as you can imagine. Um, uh, can I ask? Are you currently uh, are you currently sexually active? <UNSURE>At the moment?</UNSURE>

turns.text: No, no, not <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.text: Hmm <UNIN/> no I don't think so. Nothing unusual.

turns.text: Yep, a <UNSURE>week ago</UNSURE>, OK all right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> What I'm trying get at is whether um, uh there's any chance you could be pregnant at all. Uh, I know you're on the pill, but um we're we, nonetheless we do have to ask. <UNSURE>Um</UNSURE> when was your <UNSURE>last</UNSURE>, when was your last period?

turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT

turns.text: Two weeks ago OK, all right. Just something for <UNSURE>us</UNSURE>, to bear in mind, if your symptoms don't get any better OK, um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine, in terms of your general health otherwise at the moment are you, uh eating and drinking OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, yeah eating drinking OK. Um, I did have one kinda concern I dunno <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So <UNSURE>I</UNSURE> I smoked, uh this is quite bad, but I smoked weed for the first time.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, like a week and a half ago, I <UNIN/> I just wondered whether it's related at all, probably not but I just thought I'd get some advice from you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Sure, well thanks for sharing with me. Um, so, I, I don't think <UNSURE> it's</UNSURE> <UNIN/> is related to your symptoms, I think it probably just <UNSURE>pure</UNSURE> pure coincidence, um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sure OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sure</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But, uh, you know I do strongly advise you to you know, um, make it a regular habit if you can. Um, just for your, just for your general health moving forwards, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, fine. Moving on, in terms of your health otherwise, do you have any other medical conditions <UNIN/> , apart from the IBS, is there anything else I should be aware of?

turns.text: But my family, uh, live kind of outside of London not too far away. Um, so yeah <UNSURE>the</UNSURE> my family are fine and I see them now and then. Uh, yeah things I think, I think <UNSURE>they're</UNSURE> OK generally.

turns.text: Very <UNSURE>good</UNSURE>, very <UNSURE>good</UNSURE>, good. Um, in terms of smoking and alcohol, do you, do you participate in either?

turns.text: Uh, as I admitted before I tried weed for the first time, uh, but, uh, I don't smoke. Uh ,I drink occasionally, um, kind of socially, um, with friends <UNIN/>.

turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> O <UNSURE>K</UNSURE>

turns.text: Um, I <UNIN/> <UNSURE>it</UNSURE> was just a party,.Um, there were other people doing it, um.

turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I kind of was a little bit tipsy so, probably wasn't thinking quite straight. Um, but yeah I, I completely agree it's not something I wanna get into on a regular basis.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, uh, and obviously as your doctor I'm here to look after you so yeah I I would strongly recommend you, you know, to avoid if you can. Great, um, fine so, at this stage I wouldn't normally examine you, but I think based on your story I think, um, you know, uh, I'm reassured.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>But</UNSURE> the fact <UNSURE>that I, I</UNSURE> I think it's, um, probably just a simple what <UNSURE>we'd</UNSURE> say <UNSURE>a</UNSURE> UTI or a cystitis, bladder infection.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, you know you haven't got any other symptoms that, suggest to me that there's anything to worry about, so things like fevers and back pain.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, would be more worrying for me to hear. Um, so <UNSURE>it's</UNSURE> something we can treat quite readily with antibiotics. Um, so we've got a choice of two antibiotics something called Trimethoprim or, Nitrofurantoin which is a three day course.

turns.text: <UNSURE>And</UNSURE> normally they're usually quite effective, um, for your symptoms. It's probably worth giving us a urine sample today as well if you can, so we can send it off to the lab.

turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>
